U.S. energy production is good for Americans and our allies. 

As Russia invades Ukraine, the Biden administration must realize the need to maximize home-grown energy and not diminish America's energy independence at a time when gas and oil prices reach all-time highs.

Kansans pull together in times of need, and I encourage anyone who is able to donate.

To all those who have donated, thank you. https://t.co/cbr9tmTXD6

I am grateful for our military servicemembers stationed in Europe—and those who have recently deployed there—for demonstrating to our NATO allies in Europe and around the world that the United States can be relied upon.
While this moment underscores the need for our allies to contribute more to NATO’s defense, the United States’ commitment to our NATO obligations cannot be in doubt.
It is also imperative that all NATO allies remain unified against the Russian threat and ensure the security of the alliance’s eastern-most members.

Russia’s invasion of Ukraine is an avoidable tragedy for which Vladimir Putin is solely responsible. President Biden and our allies must impose punishing sanctions on Russia’s vital economic sectors and provide humanitarian support to Ukrainian victims of Moscow’s aggression.

#PresidentsDay recognizes the contributions American presidents have made to the success of our nation.
 
Encouraging all those who are able to visit @IkeLibrary, a testament to Kansas’ admiration for our 34th President and a man who represented the very best of our nation.

To the men and women in uniform, thank you for answering the call to protect and serve. https://t.co/NE8bvfTDMr

Words alone cannot deliver the solutions owed to our nation’s heroes. We must seize the opportunity at hand to advance legislation that will bring us one step closer to connecting all generations of veterans with the care they need and have earned.

That's why @SenatorTester & I, as leaders of the VA Committee, have introduced the Health Care for Burn Pit Veterans Act—bipartisan legislation that will offer every post-9/11 veteran suffering from effects of toxic exposures access to timely & high-quality care through the VA.
Far too many of them face yet another battle here at home when seeking the care and the benefits they desperately need. Our veterans deserve better. And they are tired of waiting for solutions.

Decade after decade, American men and women have deployed to countries across the globe in the defense of our freedom. Thousands of them were exposed to harmful toxins during that service that resulted in life-altering health conditions.

There is no substitute – no alternative – our nation can turn to in the absence of blood donations.

This shortage is severe, and it is affecting patient care across Kansas. Please, if you are able, consider donating. Find a donation site near you by visiting the @RedCross. https://t.co/tRbWYFqRY8

During today's press conference in NYC, Pres. Biden iterated his desire to ban assault weapons & place limits on magazine capacity. Yet, states like New York have some of the strictest gun control laws in the country and continue to experience near record levels of violent crime.

Instead of being tough on the criminals who go after our law enforcement officers – the moms & dads, siblings & children who put their life on the line to protect our communities – the Biden administration wants to use this moment to advocate for more gun control.
The attacks against police officers highlight the increasing intensity and occurrence of violent crime taking place in communities across America.
I need greater assurances that this administration will not use the Fed to diminish the role of the energy sector—or any other private sector.

The Federal Reserve commits to its neutrality.

U.S. energy production is good for Americans and our allies. When the EU is reluctant to join us in our efforts to effectively deter Vladimir Putin due to their dependency on Russian energy, the Biden administration must realize the importance of U.S. energy production. https://t.co/P8zb6bWdck

The national liver allocation policy is the difference between life and death for those needing an organ transplant. It must be fair no matter where you live or who you are.

Sen. @RoyBlunt and I are urging the Biden administration to reverse this biased, partial & unjust policy.

Around the world, approximately 45 million people are teetering on the brink of famine across 43 countries.
 
@SenBobCasey & I along with our Senate colleagues are urging the release of emergency food aid to provide assistance during this time of exceptional need.

There is still work to do to eliminate antisemitic violence in America. Jews represent only 2% of the U.S. population but are the victims of 58% of religiously-motivated crime. Our Jewish friends should be able to go about their lives and practice their faith without fear.

Robba & I are grateful the hostages at the Congregation Beth Israel synagogue are safe and express our gratitude to all law enforcement involved in resolving this dangerous situation. 

Anti-Semitism is unacceptable in our society, & I forcefully condemn these acts of violence.

New documents released this week as a result of an appeals court ruling, unfortunately, demonstrate how warranted our concerns were. They show clear collusion and bias by UNOS officials during the process of rewriting the nation’s liver policy.

For three years, Sen. @RoyBlunt and I have sounded the alarm about the United Network for Organ Sharing’s (UNOS) move to change the liver allocation policy, resulting in longer wait times for those in Midwestern and Southern states.

Sen. Isakson dedicated 40+ yrs of his life to public service. It was a privilege to work & learn from him – especially to support our nation's veterans. His love, care & advocacy for vets was unmatched, & he was a role model for all of us under his leadership on the VA Committee. https://t.co/Vu65ySAS1B
He conducted himself with warmth and compassion towards everyone he encountered, and so many of us were fortunate to call him a friend.
Robba and I are saddened to learn of the passing of Sen. Johnny Isakson. Sen. Isakson was a passionate and respected statesman who was truly appreciated and loved by his colleagues and staff.

I am vaccinated, and I will continue to urge Kansans to get vaccinated, but that decision should be left to each individual in consultation with doctors they trust - not bureaucrats in Washington.

Last week, I voted to overturn President Biden's federal vaccine mandate for private businesses with a bipartisan majority of the Senate. This vaccine mandate is a clear overreach of authority by the White House & threatens to worsen labor shortages.

Today, Democrats moved to raise the debt limit by $2.5 trillion, pushing our national debt over a staggering $30 trillion. Hiking up the debt limit to facilitate their out-of-control spending will jeopardize our economy, drive up inflation and hurt American families. https://t.co/Ljq0FSR3Jq

“Bob Dole was the first United States senator I ever met . . . the first senator I ever had a chance to shake a hand with. And I have been in awe of Bob Dole for 52 years since then.”
https://t.co/NFZry0xKRd

Watch Live at 11am CT: U.S. Senator Robert J. Dole’s memorial service in his hometown of Russell, Kansas
https://t.co/g2DRvzjA87

Today, we will celebrate the life and legacy of Robert J. Dole in his hometown of Russell, Kansas. To the people of Russell and to the people across Kansas, thank you for the manner in which you have shaped, treated and respected a man worthy of our admiration.

Tomorrow, Sen. Bob Dole makes his final trip home. 

📍Russell, Kan. | St. Mary Queen of Angels Catholic Church
9:00-10:30am - public viewing
11:00am- public service

📍 Topeka, Kan. | Kansas Capitol
4:00pm - public ceremony

Full details: https://t.co/dutxUWyM6Q https://t.co/fHNNryLNJb

Today, Kansas became just the 7th state in the Union to have more than one person lie in state. 

On behalf of a grateful state, we say a humbled thank you to Senator Bob Dole. https://t.co/ChxpY7EkV8

This morning, we paid our respects to Senator Bob Dole in the U.S. Capitol rotunda. He was a hero to so many Kansans and Americans, and it is fitting his own hero – President Dwight D. Eisenhower – is watching over him as he lie in state. https://t.co/8W8L2sgPM3

Sen. Bob Dole will lie in state in the U.S. Capitol, visiting for the last time the building he served in for nearly 36 years. Following President Eisenhower, Sen. Dole will be the 2nd Kansan & 33rd individual to lie in state in the Capitol rotunda—36th in the Capitol building. https://t.co/IhA3l1rFxm

This ceremony is one of the highest honors our nation can bestow upon one of its citizens, and it is bestowed only upon those who have lived a life that encompasses the varied spirit of America and its people. https://t.co/TdeYzCSNey

During an Honor Flight at the WWII Memorial in 2008, Sen. Bob Dole welcomed my dad, Ray. Because of Sen. Dole, my father had the opportunity to visit the memorial built in his honor – and in the honor of the Greatest Generation. https://t.co/TlQyddDJQ7

Sen. Dole demanded a memorial worthy of the sacrifice of our Greatest Generation. Not only did he demand it, he helped plan it, raised nearly $200 million to build it and, once completed, Sen. Dole welcomed countless WWII veterans on Honor Flights from across the country. https://t.co/RAyxc4zZ9v
God Bless Senator Bob Dole. https://t.co/7NiKMVmdRO
Joining Kansas leaders this morning at the @WWIIMemorial to honor Senator Bob Dole. Watch live: https://t.co/5eiw3Dg6es

On the 80th anniversary of the attack on Pearl Harbor, we remember the 2,403 brave men and women who lost their lives. They are part of the story that forever changed the course of history, and we honor their sacrifice to this country. https://t.co/lsE3GUTXAq

The U.S. Senate unanimously passed a resolution honoring Senator Bob Dole last night. 
 
He lived a life worthy of our admiration and respect, and I was honored to lead this resolution with @RogerMarshallMD to recognize his lifetime of service. https://t.co/EEH1V82fYl

Kansans have held Sen. Dole in the highest regard. They’ve appreciated his service; they’ve respected him – even in disagreement.

This week, we're going to spend time honoring Sen. Dole, and thank him for a lifetime of service.

Captured this photo on my way to pay tribute to Sen. Bob Dole on the Senate Floor. 

Sen. Dole will be carried up these steps to lie in state in the Capitol Rotunda on Thursday morning – one of the greatest honors in our nation. https://t.co/Etsr9tIjJm

Speaking now on the U.S. Senate Floor to pay tribute to the life and legacy of Senator Bob Dole. 

Tune in here: https://t.co/kdDrJBldkJ

Sen. Dole went out of his way to make sure WWII veterans – really every veteran – were appreciated. 
 
Watch more from @KCTV5 on Sen. Dole’s service to our country. https://t.co/2xkgxTa2oe
My full statement on the passing of Senator Bob Dole: https://t.co/YuLidQ4Uzy

Senator Bob Dole never gave up his indomitable spirit to make sure that good things happen for Kansans and Americans. He is a role model for all of us, Republicans and Democrats, that serve in the United States Senate. 

I joined @FoxNews to discuss his legacy: https://t.co/3ubnKkDZb4
Tune in: On @FoxNews with @MikeEmanuelFox now discussing the life and legacy of Senator Bob Dole.

On the Senate floor, I use Sen. Dole’s desk, & I am regularly reminded of his tireless commitment to Kansas values while being, first & foremost, a statesman who treated others with respect & kindness. https://t.co/IBUiI3iF69
Throughout Sen. Dole’s life, he exemplified the ideals, sacrifice and tenacity of the Greatest Generation.

Whether it was on the battlefield, in the halls of Congress, or in his everyday life, Sen. Dole’s passion and dedication to his fellow Kansan and to his country was a steady reminder that a single person can make a difference and change the world. https://t.co/K61Rjn6x5Y

Sen. Bob Dole will be remembered as a true American hero & an exemplary statesman – a man who chose what was right over what was convenient.  

Robba and I are praying for Sen. Elizabeth Dole and the entire Dole family.

To protect the integrity of the commission - and because it’s just plain common sense - I introduced legislation with @SenJohnThune, @SenMikeLee, @RoyBlunt, @SenTedCruz, @SenLummis & @SenRonJohnson to stop FTC commissioner votes from being counted after they have left their post.

Your last day in office is the last day your vote should count — whether you serve on the school board or the FTC. It’s absurd that votes cast by commissioners on outstanding issues can be counted up to 60 days past their departure. 
https://t.co/ttQRAq2bt3
